strategy: Use CatBoostClassifier with the following settings: iterations=500, learning_rate=0.03, depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median. Drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Do not use get_dummies for categorical columns; instead, pass the cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categorical columns to strings first.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostClassifier

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
threshold = 0.5
missing_ratio = train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > threshold].index
train = train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
test = test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Handle NaN values in numeric columns by filling with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numeric_columns:
    train[col].fillna(train[col].median(), inplace=True)
    test[col].fillna(test[col].median(), inplace=True)

# Handle categorical columns: cast to string and identify them
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in train.columns:
        train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    if col in test.columns:
        test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical columns for CatBoost
cat_features = [0, 1, 6, 7, 8, 9]  # indices for Sex, Embarked, Name, Ticket, Cabin (after casting to string)

# Prepare features and target
X = train.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train['Survived']

# Ensure only relevant columns are used
X = X.reindex(columns=[col for col in X.columns if col in test.columns])
X = X.reindex(columns=[col for col in X.columns if col in train.columns])

# Train CatBoost model
model = CatBoostClassifier(
    iterations=500,
    learning_rate=0.03,
    depth=6,
    verbose=False
)
model.fit(X, y, cat_features=cat_features)

# Predict on test set
test_ids = test['PassengerId']
test_features = test.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
predictions = model.predict(test_features)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_ids,
    'Survived': predictions
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostClassifier

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
threshold = 0.5
missing_ratio = train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > threshold].index
train = train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
test = test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Handle NaN values in numeric columns by filling with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numeric_columns:
    train[col].fillna(train[col].median(), inplace=True)
    test[col].fillna(test[col].median(), inplace=True)

# Handle categorical columns: cast to string
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in train.columns:
        train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    if col in test.columns:
        test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical columns for CatBoost (use actual column indices)
# First, get the list of feature columns in order
feature_columns = train.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1).columns.tolist()
cat_features = []
for i, col in enumerate(feature_columns):
    if col in ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']:
        cat_features.append(i)

# Prepare features and target
X = train.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train['Survived']

# Ensure test features have the same columns as train
test_features = test.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_features = test_features.reindex(columns=X.columns, fill_value=0)

# Train CatBoost model
model = CatBoostClassifier(
    iterations=500,
    learning_rate=0.03,
    depth=6,
    verbose=False
)
model.fit(X, y, cat_features=cat_features)

# Predict on test set
test_ids = test['PassengerId']
predictions = model.predict(test_features)

# Create submission

    'PassengerId': test_ids,

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostClassifier

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
threshold = 0.5
missing_ratio = train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > threshold].index
train = train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
test = test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Handle NaN values in numeric columns by filling with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
for col in numeric_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].fillna(train[col].median())
    test[col] = test[col].fillna(test[col].median())

# Handle categorical columns: cast to string
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in train.columns:
        train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    if col in test.columns:
        test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical columns for CatBoost using actual column indices
feature_columns = train.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1).columns.tolist()
cat_features = []
for i, col in enumerate(feature_columns):
    if col in ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']:
        cat_features.append(i)

# Prepare features and target
X = train.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train['Survived']

# Ensure test features have the same columns as train
test_features = test.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_features = test_features.reindex(columns=X.columns, fill_value=0)

# Train CatBoost model
model = CatBoostClassifier(
    iterations=500,
    learning_rate=0.03,
    depth=6,
    verbose=False
)
model.fit(X, y, cat_features=cat_features)

# Predict on test set
test_ids = test['PassengerId']
predictions = model.predict(test_features)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_ids,
    'Survived': predictions
})

# Save submission
